conclusion: To determine the direction of the acceleration of the skydiver during the interval from 0 to 10 seconds, we can analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph provided.
The graph shows the velocity v on the y-axis and time t on the x-axis.
The slope of the graph at any given point represents the acceleration at that time. This is because acceleration a is the derivative of velocity with respect to time (a = dv/dt).
During the 0 to 10 seconds interval, the velocity increases from 0 to 20 m/s.
The graph shows a positive slope throughout this interval, indicating that the velocity is increasing over time.

premise: The graph shows a positive slope throughout this interval.
conclusion: A positive slope on a v-t graph means that the acceleration is positive.

premise: Positive acceleration indicates that the skydiver is speeding up (accelerating) in the direction of motion, which is downward due to gravity.
conclusion: The direction of the acceleration is downward.
